optimization.algorithms.gradient_based.nelder_meadÂ¶

Source: src\optimization\algorithms\gradient_based\nelder_mead.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Nelder-Mead simplex optimization algorithm.

Advanced Mathematical TheoryÂ¶

Nelder-Mead Simplex MethodÂ¶

Simplex: Set of \(n+1\) vertices in \(\mathbb{R}^n\):

\[S = \{\vec{x}_1, \ldots, \vec{x}_{n+1}\}\]

Centroid of best \(n\) vertices:

\[\bar{\vec{x}} = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} \vec{x}_i \quad (\text{excluding worst})\]

Simplex OperationsÂ¶

Reflection:

\[\vec{x}_r = \bar{\vec{x}} + \alpha (\bar{\vec{x}} - \vec{x}_{n+1}), \quad \alpha = 1\]

Expansion:

\[\vec{x}_e = \bar{\vec{x}} + \gamma (\vec{x}_r - \bar{\vec{x}}), \quad \gamma = 2\]

Contraction (outside):

\[\vec{x}_c = \bar{\vec{x}} + \rho (\vec{x}_r - \bar{\vec{x}}), \quad \rho = 0.5\]

Contraction (inside):

\[\vec{x}_{cc} = \bar{\vec{x}} - \rho (\bar{\vec{x}} - \vec{x}_{n+1}), \quad \rho = 0.5\]

Shrink:

\[\vec{x}_i = \vec{x}_1 + \sigma (\vec{x}_i - \vec{x}_1), \quad \sigma = 0.5, \, i = 2, \ldots, n+1\]

Algorithm FlowÂ¶

1. Sort: f(x_1) â‰¤ f(x_2) â‰¤ ... â‰¤ f(x_{n+1})
2. Reflect: x_r = centroid + Î±(centroid - x_{worst})
3. If f(x_1) â‰¤ f(x_r) < f(x_n): Accept reflection
4. If f(x_r) < f(x_1): Try expansion
5. If f(x_r) â‰¥ f(x_n): Try contraction
6. If contraction fails: Shrink simplex

Convergence PropertiesÂ¶

Theorem (Lagarias et al. 1998): For strictly convex \(f\) with bounded level sets:

\[\lim_{k \to \infty} \text{diam}(S_k) = 0\]

Limitation: May converge to non-stationary points for non-convex functions.

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[Simplex] --> B[Sort Vertices] B --> C[Compute Centroid] C --> D[Reflection] D --> E{f(x_r) Quality} E -->|Best| F[Try Expansion] E -->|Good| G[Accept Reflection] E -->|Poor| H[Try Contraction] F --> I{f(x_e) < f(x_r)?} I -->|Yes| J[Accept Expansion] I -->|No| G H --> K{Outside or Inside?} K -->|Outside| L[Contract Outside] K -->|Inside| M[Contract Inside] L --> N{Accept Contraction?} M --> N N -->|Yes| O[Update Simplex] N -->|No| P[Shrink All] G --> O J --> O P --> O O --> Q{Converged?} Q -->|No| B Q -->|Yes| R[Return Best] style E fill:#ff9 style K fill:#9cf style R fill:#9f9

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic InitializationÂ¶

from src.optimization.algorithms import *

# Initialize with configuration
config = {'parameter': 'value'}
instance = Component(config)

Example 2: Performance TuningÂ¶

# Adjust parameters for better performance
optimized_params = tune_parameters(instance, target_performance)

Example 3: Integration with OptimizationÂ¶

# Use in complete optimization loop
optimizer = create_optimizer(opt_type, config)
result = optimize(optimizer, problem, max_iter=100)

Example 4: Edge Case HandlingÂ¶

try:
    output = instance.compute(parameters)
except ValueError as e:
    handle_edge_case(e)

Example 5: Performance AnalysisÂ¶

# Analyze metrics
metrics = compute_metrics(result)
print(f"Best fitness: {metrics.best_fitness:.3f}")

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#============= src/optimization/algorithms/gradient_based/nelder_mead.py ==============\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Nelder-Mead simplex optimization algorithm."""
  6
  7from __future__ import annotations
  8
  9from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional
 10import numpy as np
 11import warnings
 12from dataclasses import dataclass
 13
 14from ..base import OptimizationAlgorithm
 15from ...core.interfaces import OptimizationProblem, ParameterSpace, OptimizationResult
 16from ...core.parameters import ContinuousParameterSpace
 17
 18
 19@dataclass
 20class NelderMeadConfig:
 21    """Configuration for Nelder-Mead algorithm."""
 22    max_iterations: int = 1000
 23    max_evaluations: int = 10000
 24    tolerance: float = 1e-6
 25    reflection_coeff: float = 1.0
 26    expansion_coeff: float = 2.0
 27    contraction_coeff: float = 0.5
 28    shrinkage_coeff: float = 0.5
 29    initial_step_size: float = 0.1
 30    adaptive_parameters: bool = True
 31    random_seed: Optional[int] = None
 32
 33
 34class NelderMeadSimplex:
 35    """Nelder-Mead simplex data structure."""
 36
 37    def __init__(self, vertices: List[np.ndarray], function_values: List[float]):
 38        self.vertices = vertices
 39        self.function_values = function_values
 40        self.dimension = len(vertices[0])
 41
 42        # Sort vertices by function value
 43        self._sort_vertices()
 44
 45    def _sort_vertices(self):
 46        """Sort vertices by function value (best first)."""
 47        sorted_indices = np.argsort(self.function_values)
 48        self.vertices = [self.vertices[i] for i in sorted_indices]
 49        self.function_values = [self.function_values[i] for i in sorted_indices]
 50
 51    @property
 52    def best_vertex(self) -> np.ndarray:
 53        """Get the best vertex."""
 54        return self.vertices[0]
 55
 56    @property
 57    def best_value(self) -> float:
 58        """Get the best function value."""
 59        return self.function_values[0]
 60
 61    @property
 62    def worst_vertex(self) -> np.ndarray:
 63        """Get the worst vertex."""
 64        return self.vertices[-1]
 65
 66    @property
 67    def worst_value(self) -> float:
 68        """Get the worst function value."""
 69        return self.function_values[-1]
 70
 71    @property
 72    def second_worst_vertex(self) -> np.ndarray:
 73        """Get the second worst vertex."""
 74        return self.vertices[-2]
 75
 76    @property
 77    def second_worst_value(self) -> float:
 78        """Get the second worst function value."""
 79        return self.function_values[-2]
 80
 81    def centroid(self, exclude_worst: bool = True) -> np.ndarray:
 82        """Calculate centroid of simplex."""
 83        if exclude_worst:
 84            vertices = self.vertices[:-1]  # Exclude worst vertex
 85        else:
 86            vertices = self.vertices
 87
 88        return np.mean(vertices, axis=0)
 89
 90    def replace_worst(self, new_vertex: np.ndarray, new_value: float):
 91        """Replace worst vertex with new vertex."""
 92        self.vertices[-1] = new_vertex
 93        self.function_values[-1] = new_value
 94        self._sort_vertices()
 95
 96    def shrink_simplex(self, shrinkage_coeff: float):
 97        """Shrink simplex towards best vertex."""
 98        best = self.best_vertex
 99        for i in range(1, len(self.vertices)):
100            self.vertices[i] = best + shrinkage_coeff * (self.vertices[i] - best)
101
102    def volume(self) -> float:
103        """Calculate simplex volume."""
104        # Simplified volume calculation using standard deviation of vertices
105        vertices_array = np.array(self.vertices)
106        return np.std(vertices_array)
107
108
109class NelderMead(OptimizationAlgorithm):
110    """Nelder-Mead simplex optimization algorithm.
111
112    The Nelder-Mead algorithm is a direct search method that uses a simplex
113    (n+1 vertices in n dimensions) to navigate the parameter space. It uses
114    reflection, expansion, contraction, and shrinkage operations to adapt
115    the simplex shape and converge to the optimum.
116
117    Features:
118    - Derivative-free optimization
119    - Adaptive simplex operations
120    - Boundary constraint handling
121    - Convergence detection
122    - Robust parameter adaptation
123    """
124
125    def __init__(self, config: Optional[NelderMeadConfig] = None):
126        """Initialize Nelder-Mead algorithm.
127
128        Parameters
129        ----------
130        config : NelderMeadConfig, optional
131            Algorithm configuration. If None, uses default values.
132        """
133        super().__init__()
134        self.config = config if config is not None else NelderMeadConfig()
135
136        # Initialize random number generator
137        if self.config.random_seed is not None:
138            np.random.seed(self.config.random_seed)
139
140        # Algorithm state
141        self.simplex: Optional[NelderMeadSimplex] = None
142        self.iteration = 0
143        self.n_evaluations = 0
144        self.convergence_history: List[float] = []
145        self.simplex_volume_history: List[float] = []
146
147        # Adaptive parameters
148        self.current_reflection = self.config.reflection_coeff
149        self.current_expansion = self.config.expansion_coeff
150        self.current_contraction = self.config.contraction_coeff
151        self.current_shrinkage = self.config.shrinkage_coeff
152
153    def optimize(self,
154                problem: OptimizationProblem,
155                parameter_space: ParameterSpace,
156                initial_guess: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
157                **kwargs) -> OptimizationResult:
158        """Run Nelder-Mead optimization.
159
160        Parameters
161        ----------
162        problem : OptimizationProblem
163            The optimization problem to solve
164        parameter_space : ParameterSpace
165            Parameter space defining bounds and constraints
166        initial_guess : np.ndarray, optional
167            Initial parameter guess
168
169        Returns
170        -------
171        OptimizationResult
172            Optimization results
173        """
174        if not isinstance(parameter_space, ContinuousParameterSpace):
175            raise ValueError("NelderMead currently only supports ContinuousParameterSpace")
176
177        self.problem = problem
178        self.parameter_space = parameter_space
179        self.dimension = len(parameter_space.lower_bounds)
180
181        # Initialize simplex
182        self._initialize_simplex(initial_guess)
183
184        # Optimization loop
185        while not self._check_termination():
186            self._perform_iteration()
187            self.iteration += 1
188
189        # Create result
190        result = self._create_result()
191        return result
192
193    def _initialize_simplex(self, initial_guess: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
194        """Initialize the simplex."""
195        if initial_guess is not None:
196            # Validate initial guess
197            initial_guess = np.clip(initial_guess,
198                                  self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
199                                  self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
200            start_point = initial_guess
201        else:
202            # Random start point within bounds
203            start_point = np.random.uniform(
204                self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
205                self.parameter_space.upper_bounds
206            )
207
208        # Create initial simplex vertices
209        vertices = [start_point.copy()]
210        step_size = self.config.initial_step_size
211
212        # Calculate appropriate step sizes for each dimension
213        ranges = self.parameter_space.upper_bounds - self.parameter_space.lower_bounds
214        step_sizes = step_size * ranges
215
216        # Create n additional vertices by perturbing each dimension
217        for i in range(self.dimension):
218            new_vertex = start_point.copy()
219            perturbation = step_sizes[i]
220
221            # Try positive perturbation first
222            new_vertex[i] = min(start_point[i] + perturbation,
223                               self.parameter_space.upper_bounds[i])
224
225            # If at boundary, try negative perturbation
226            if new_vertex[i] >= self.parameter_space.upper_bounds[i]:
227                new_vertex[i] = max(start_point[i] - perturbation,
228                                   self.parameter_space.lower_bounds[i])
229
230            vertices.append(new_vertex)
231
232        # Evaluate initial vertices
233        function_values = []
234        for vertex in vertices:
235            value = self._safe_evaluate(vertex)
236            function_values.append(value)
237
238        # Create simplex
239        self.simplex = NelderMeadSimplex(vertices, function_values)
240        self.convergence_history.append(self.simplex.best_value)
241        self.simplex_volume_history.append(self.simplex.volume())
242
243    def _perform_iteration(self):
244        """Perform one iteration of Nelder-Mead algorithm."""
245        # Calculate centroid (excluding worst vertex)
246        centroid = self.simplex.centroid(exclude_worst=True)
247
248        # Reflection
249        reflected_point = self._reflect(centroid, self.simplex.worst_vertex)
250        reflected_value = self._safe_evaluate(reflected_point)
251
252        if self.simplex.best_value <= reflected_value < self.simplex.second_worst_value:
253            # Accept reflection
254            self.simplex.replace_worst(reflected_point, reflected_value)
255
256        elif reflected_value < self.simplex.best_value:
257            # Try expansion
258            expanded_point = self._expand(centroid, reflected_point)
259            expanded_value = self._safe_evaluate(expanded_point)
260
261            if expanded_value < reflected_value:
262                # Accept expansion
263                self.simplex.replace_worst(expanded_point, expanded_value)
264            else:
265                # Accept reflection
266                self.simplex.replace_worst(reflected_point, reflected_value)
267
268        else:
269            # Try contraction
270            if reflected_value < self.simplex.worst_value:
271                # Outside contraction
272                contracted_point = self._contract_outside(centroid, reflected_point)
273                contracted_value = self._safe_evaluate(contracted_point)
274
275                if contracted_value <= reflected_value:
276                    self.simplex.replace_worst(contracted_point, contracted_value)
277                else:
278                    self._shrink_simplex()
279            else:
280                # Inside contraction
281                contracted_point = self._contract_inside(centroid, self.simplex.worst_vertex)
282                contracted_value = self._safe_evaluate(contracted_point)
283
284                if contracted_value < self.simplex.worst_value:
285                    self.simplex.replace_worst(contracted_point, contracted_value)
286                else:
287                    self._shrink_simplex()
288
289        # Update history
290        self.convergence_history.append(self.simplex.best_value)
291        self.simplex_volume_history.append(self.simplex.volume())
292
293        # Adaptive parameter adjustment
294        if self.config.adaptive_parameters:
295            self._update_adaptive_parameters()
296
297    def _reflect(self, centroid: np.ndarray, worst_vertex: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
298        """Perform reflection operation."""
299        reflected = centroid + self.current_reflection * (centroid - worst_vertex)
300        return self._apply_bounds(reflected)
301
302    def _expand(self, centroid: np.ndarray, reflected_point: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
303        """Perform expansion operation."""
304        expanded = centroid + self.current_expansion * (reflected_point - centroid)
305        return self._apply_bounds(expanded)
306
307    def _contract_outside(self, centroid: np.ndarray, reflected_point: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
308        """Perform outside contraction."""
309        contracted = centroid + self.current_contraction * (reflected_point - centroid)
310        return self._apply_bounds(contracted)
311
312    def _contract_inside(self, centroid: np.ndarray, worst_vertex: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
313        """Perform inside contraction."""
314        contracted = centroid + self.current_contraction * (worst_vertex - centroid)
315        return self._apply_bounds(contracted)
316
317    def _shrink_simplex(self):
318        """Shrink the entire simplex."""
319        self.simplex.shrink_simplex(self.current_shrinkage)
320
321        # Re-evaluate all vertices except the best one
322        for i in range(1, len(self.simplex.vertices)):
323            self.simplex.vertices[i] = self._apply_bounds(self.simplex.vertices[i])
324            self.simplex.function_values[i] = self._safe_evaluate(self.simplex.vertices[i])
325
326        self.simplex._sort_vertices()
327
328    def _apply_bounds(self, point: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
329        """Apply parameter bounds to a point."""
330        return np.clip(point,
331                      self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
332                      self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
333
334    def _safe_evaluate(self, point: np.ndarray) -> float:
335        """Safely evaluate objective function."""
336        try:
337            value = self.problem.evaluate(point)
338            self.n_evaluations += 1
339            return value
340        except Exception as e:
341            warnings.warn(f"Evaluation failed: {e}")
342            return float('inf')
343
344    def _update_adaptive_parameters(self):
345        """Update adaptive algorithm parameters."""
346        # Adjust parameters based on convergence progress
347        if len(self.convergence_history) > 10:
348            recent_improvement = (self.convergence_history[-10] -
349                                self.convergence_history[-1])
350
351            if recent_improvement < 1e-8:
352                # Slow convergence - increase exploration
353                self.current_reflection = min(self.current_reflection * 1.1, 2.0)
354                self.current_expansion = min(self.current_expansion * 1.05, 3.0)
355                self.current_contraction = max(self.current_contraction * 0.95, 0.1)
356            else:
357                # Good convergence - reset to default values
358                self.current_reflection = self.config.reflection_coeff
359                self.current_expansion = self.config.expansion_coeff
360                self.current_contraction = self.config.contraction_coeff
361
362    def _check_termination(self) -> bool:
363        """Check termination conditions."""
364        # Maximum iterations
365        if self.iteration >= self.config.max_iterations:
366            return True
367
368        # Maximum evaluations
369        if self.n_evaluations >= self.config.max_evaluations:
370            return True
371
372        # Convergence tolerance
373        if self.simplex is not None and len(self.convergence_history) > 1:
374            # Function value tolerance
375            function_range = (self.simplex.worst_value - self.simplex.best_value)
376            if abs(function_range) < self.config.tolerance:
377                return True
378
379            # Simplex size tolerance
380            if self.simplex.volume() < self.config.tolerance:
381                return True
382
383            # Stagnation check
384            if len(self.convergence_history) > 20:
385                recent_change = abs(self.convergence_history[-1] - self.convergence_history[-20])
386                if recent_change < self.config.tolerance:
387                    return True
388
389        return False
390
391    def _create_result(self) -> OptimizationResult:
392        """Create optimization result."""
393        if self.simplex is None:
394            return OptimizationResult(
395                best_parameters=np.array([]),
396                best_value=float('inf'),
397                n_evaluations=self.n_evaluations,
398                convergence_history=[],
399                success=False,
400                algorithm_info={'algorithm': 'NelderMead'}
401            )
402
403        return OptimizationResult(
404            best_parameters=self.simplex.best_vertex.copy(),
405            best_value=self.simplex.best_value,
406            n_evaluations=self.n_evaluations,
407            convergence_history=self.convergence_history.copy(),
408            success=np.isfinite(self.simplex.best_value),
409            algorithm_info={
410                'algorithm': 'NelderMead',
411                'iterations': self.iteration,
412                'final_simplex_volume': self.simplex.volume(),
413                'function_range': self.simplex.worst_value - self.simplex.best_value,
414                'adaptive_reflection': self.current_reflection,
415                'adaptive_expansion': self.current_expansion,
416                'adaptive_contraction': self.current_contraction
417            }
418        )
419
420    def get_simplex_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
421        """Get information about current simplex."""
422        if self.simplex is None:
423            return {}
424
425        return {
426            'iteration': self.iteration,
427            'n_evaluations': self.n_evaluations,
428            'best_vertex': self.simplex.best_vertex.tolist(),
429            'best_value': self.simplex.best_value,
430            'worst_value': self.simplex.worst_value,
431            'function_range': self.simplex.worst_value - self.simplex.best_value,
432            'simplex_volume': self.simplex.volume(),
433            'centroid': self.simplex.centroid().tolist(),
434            'convergence_rate': self._estimate_convergence_rate()
435        }
436
437    def _estimate_convergence_rate(self) -> float:
438        """Estimate convergence rate."""
439        if len(self.convergence_history) < 10:
440            return 0.0
441
442        # Calculate exponential convergence rate
443        recent_history = self.convergence_history[-10:]
444        if len(set(recent_history)) <= 1:  # All values the same
445            return 0.0
446
447        try:
448            # Fit exponential decay
449            x = np.arange(len(recent_history))
450            y = np.array(recent_history)
451
452            # Avoid log of non-positive numbers
453            y_shifted = y - np.min(y) + 1e-10
454            log_y = np.log(y_shifted)
455
456            slope, _ = np.polyfit(x, log_y, 1)
457            return abs(slope)
458        except Exception:
459            return 0.0
460
461    def restart_simplex(self, perturbation_factor: float = 0.1):
462        """Restart simplex with perturbation."""
463        if self.simplex is None:
464            return
465
466        # Keep best vertex, perturb others
467        best_vertex = self.simplex.best_vertex.copy()
468        ranges = self.parameter_space.upper_bounds - self.parameter_space.lower_bounds
469        perturbation = perturbation_factor * ranges
470
471        new_vertices = [best_vertex]
472        for i in range(self.dimension):
473            new_vertex = best_vertex.copy()
474            new_vertex[i] += np.random.normal(0, perturbation[i])
475            new_vertex = self._apply_bounds(new_vertex)
476            new_vertices.append(new_vertex)
477
478        # Evaluate new vertices
479        function_values = []
480        for vertex in new_vertices:
481            value = self._safe_evaluate(vertex)
482            function_values.append(value)
483
484        self.simplex = NelderMeadSimplex(new_vertices, function_values)

ClassesÂ¶

NelderMeadConfigÂ¶

Configuration for Nelder-Mead algorithm.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1@dataclass
 2class NelderMeadConfig:
 3    """Configuration for Nelder-Mead algorithm."""
 4    max_iterations: int = 1000
 5    max_evaluations: int = 10000
 6    tolerance: float = 1e-6
 7    reflection_coeff: float = 1.0
 8    expansion_coeff: float = 2.0
 9    contraction_coeff: float = 0.5
10    shrinkage_coeff: float = 0.5
11    initial_step_size: float = 0.1
12    adaptive_parameters: bool = True
13    random_seed: Optional[int] = None

NelderMeadSimplexÂ¶

Nelder-Mead simplex data structure.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class NelderMeadSimplex:
 2    """Nelder-Mead simplex data structure."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, vertices: List[np.ndarray], function_values: List[float]):
 5        self.vertices = vertices
 6        self.function_values = function_values
 7        self.dimension = len(vertices[0])
 8
 9        # Sort vertices by function value
10        self._sort_vertices()
11
12    def _sort_vertices(self):
13        """Sort vertices by function value (best first)."""
14        sorted_indices = np.argsort(self.function_values)
15        self.vertices = [self.vertices[i] for i in sorted_indices]
16        self.function_values = [self.function_values[i] for i in sorted_indices]
17
18    @property
19    def best_vertex(self) -> np.ndarray:
20        """Get the best vertex."""
21        return self.vertices[0]
22
23    @property
24    def best_value(self) -> float:
25        """Get the best function value."""
26        return self.function_values[0]
27
28    @property
29    def worst_vertex(self) -> np.ndarray:
30        """Get the worst vertex."""
31        return self.vertices[-1]
32
33    @property
34    def worst_value(self) -> float:
35        """Get the worst function value."""
36        return self.function_values[-1]
37
38    @property
39    def second_worst_vertex(self) -> np.ndarray:
40        """Get the second worst vertex."""
41        return self.vertices[-2]
42
43    @property
44    def second_worst_value(self) -> float:
45        """Get the second worst function value."""
46        return self.function_values[-2]
47
48    def centroid(self, exclude_worst: bool = True) -> np.ndarray:
49        """Calculate centroid of simplex."""
50        if exclude_worst:
51            vertices = self.vertices[:-1]  # Exclude worst vertex
52        else:
53            vertices = self.vertices
54
55        return np.mean(vertices, axis=0)
56
57    def replace_worst(self, new_vertex: np.ndarray, new_value: float):
58        """Replace worst vertex with new vertex."""
59        self.vertices[-1] = new_vertex
60        self.function_values[-1] = new_value
61        self._sort_vertices()
62
63    def shrink_simplex(self, shrinkage_coeff: float):
64        """Shrink simplex towards best vertex."""
65        best = self.best_vertex
66        for i in range(1, len(self.vertices)):
67            self.vertices[i] = best + shrinkage_coeff * (self.vertices[i] - best)
68
69    def volume(self) -> float:
70        """Calculate simplex volume."""
71        # Simplified volume calculation using standard deviation of vertices
72        vertices_array = np.array(self.vertices)
73        return np.std(vertices_array)

NelderMeadÂ¶

Inherits from: OptimizationAlgorithm

Nelder-Mead simplex optimization algorithm.

The Nelder-Mead algorithm is a direct search method that uses a simplex (n+1 vertices in n dimensions) to navigate the parameter space. It uses reflection, expansion, contraction, and shrinkage operations to adapt the simplex shape and converge to the optimum.

Features:

  • Derivative-free optimization

  • Adaptive simplex operations

  • Boundary constraint handling

  • Convergence detection

  • Robust parameter adaptation

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class NelderMead(OptimizationAlgorithm):
  2    """Nelder-Mead simplex optimization algorithm.
  3
  4    The Nelder-Mead algorithm is a direct search method that uses a simplex
  5    (n+1 vertices in n dimensions) to navigate the parameter space. It uses
  6    reflection, expansion, contraction, and shrinkage operations to adapt
  7    the simplex shape and converge to the optimum.
  8
  9    Features:
 10    - Derivative-free optimization
 11    - Adaptive simplex operations
 12    - Boundary constraint handling
 13    - Convergence detection
 14    - Robust parameter adaptation
 15    """
 16
 17    def __init__(self, config: Optional[NelderMeadConfig] = None):
 18        """Initialize Nelder-Mead algorithm.
 19
 20        Parameters
 21        ----------
 22        config : NelderMeadConfig, optional
 23            Algorithm configuration. If None, uses default values.
 24        """
 25        super().__init__()
 26        self.config = config if config is not None else NelderMeadConfig()
 27
 28        # Initialize random number generator
 29        if self.config.random_seed is not None:
 30            np.random.seed(self.config.random_seed)
 31
 32        # Algorithm state
 33        self.simplex: Optional[NelderMeadSimplex] = None
 34        self.iteration = 0
 35        self.n_evaluations = 0
 36        self.convergence_history: List[float] = []
 37        self.simplex_volume_history: List[float] = []
 38
 39        # Adaptive parameters
 40        self.current_reflection = self.config.reflection_coeff
 41        self.current_expansion = self.config.expansion_coeff
 42        self.current_contraction = self.config.contraction_coeff
 43        self.current_shrinkage = self.config.shrinkage_coeff
 44
 45    def optimize(self,
 46                problem: OptimizationProblem,
 47                parameter_space: ParameterSpace,
 48                initial_guess: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
 49                **kwargs) -> OptimizationResult:
 50        """Run Nelder-Mead optimization.
 51
 52        Parameters
 53        ----------
 54        problem : OptimizationProblem
 55            The optimization problem to solve
 56        parameter_space : ParameterSpace
 57            Parameter space defining bounds and constraints
 58        initial_guess : np.ndarray, optional
 59            Initial parameter guess
 60
 61        Returns
 62        -------
 63        OptimizationResult
 64            Optimization results
 65        """
 66        if not isinstance(parameter_space, ContinuousParameterSpace):
 67            raise ValueError("NelderMead currently only supports ContinuousParameterSpace")
 68
 69        self.problem = problem
 70        self.parameter_space = parameter_space
 71        self.dimension = len(parameter_space.lower_bounds)
 72
 73        # Initialize simplex
 74        self._initialize_simplex(initial_guess)
 75
 76        # Optimization loop
 77        while not self._check_termination():
 78            self._perform_iteration()
 79            self.iteration += 1
 80
 81        # Create result
 82        result = self._create_result()
 83        return result
 84
 85    def _initialize_simplex(self, initial_guess: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
 86        """Initialize the simplex."""
 87        if initial_guess is not None:
 88            # Validate initial guess
 89            initial_guess = np.clip(initial_guess,
 90                                  self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
 91                                  self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
 92            start_point = initial_guess
 93        else:
 94            # Random start point within bounds
 95            start_point = np.random.uniform(
 96                self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
 97                self.parameter_space.upper_bounds
 98            )
 99
100        # Create initial simplex vertices
101        vertices = [start_point.copy()]
102        step_size = self.config.initial_step_size
103
104        # Calculate appropriate step sizes for each dimension
105        ranges = self.parameter_space.upper_bounds - self.parameter_space.lower_bounds
106        step_sizes = step_size * ranges
107
108        # Create n additional vertices by perturbing each dimension
109        for i in range(self.dimension):
110            new_vertex = start_point.copy()
111            perturbation = step_sizes[i]
112
113            # Try positive perturbation first
114            new_vertex[i] = min(start_point[i] + perturbation,
115                               self.parameter_space.upper_bounds[i])
116
117            # If at boundary, try negative perturbation
118            if new_vertex[i] >= self.parameter_space.upper_bounds[i]:
119                new_vertex[i] = max(start_point[i] - perturbation,
120                                   self.parameter_space.lower_bounds[i])
121
122            vertices.append(new_vertex)
123
124        # Evaluate initial vertices
125        function_values = []
126        for vertex in vertices:
127            value = self._safe_evaluate(vertex)
128            function_values.append(value)
129
130        # Create simplex
131        self.simplex = NelderMeadSimplex(vertices, function_values)
132        self.convergence_history.append(self.simplex.best_value)
133        self.simplex_volume_history.append(self.simplex.volume())
134
135    def _perform_iteration(self):
136        """Perform one iteration of Nelder-Mead algorithm."""
137        # Calculate centroid (excluding worst vertex)
138        centroid = self.simplex.centroid(exclude_worst=True)
139
140        # Reflection
141        reflected_point = self._reflect(centroid, self.simplex.worst_vertex)
142        reflected_value = self._safe_evaluate(reflected_point)
143
144        if self.simplex.best_value <= reflected_value < self.simplex.second_worst_value:
145            # Accept reflection
146            self.simplex.replace_worst(reflected_point, reflected_value)
147
148        elif reflected_value < self.simplex.best_value:
149            # Try expansion
150            expanded_point = self._expand(centroid, reflected_point)
151            expanded_value = self._safe_evaluate(expanded_point)
152
153            if expanded_value < reflected_value:
154                # Accept expansion
155                self.simplex.replace_worst(expanded_point, expanded_value)
156            else:
157                # Accept reflection
158                self.simplex.replace_worst(reflected_point, reflected_value)
159
160        else:
161            # Try contraction
162            if reflected_value < self.simplex.worst_value:
163                # Outside contraction
164                contracted_point = self._contract_outside(centroid, reflected_point)
165                contracted_value = self._safe_evaluate(contracted_point)
166
167                if contracted_value <= reflected_value:
168                    self.simplex.replace_worst(contracted_point, contracted_value)
169                else:
170                    self._shrink_simplex()
171            else:
172                # Inside contraction
173                contracted_point = self._contract_inside(centroid, self.simplex.worst_vertex)
174                contracted_value = self._safe_evaluate(contracted_point)
175
176                if contracted_value < self.simplex.worst_value:
177                    self.simplex.replace_worst(contracted_point, contracted_value)
178                else:
179                    self._shrink_simplex()
180
181        # Update history
182        self.convergence_history.append(self.simplex.best_value)
183        self.simplex_volume_history.append(self.simplex.volume())
184
185        # Adaptive parameter adjustment
186        if self.config.adaptive_parameters:
187            self._update_adaptive_parameters()
188
189    def _reflect(self, centroid: np.ndarray, worst_vertex: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
190        """Perform reflection operation."""
191        reflected = centroid + self.current_reflection * (centroid - worst_vertex)
192        return self._apply_bounds(reflected)
193
194    def _expand(self, centroid: np.ndarray, reflected_point: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
195        """Perform expansion operation."""
196        expanded = centroid + self.current_expansion * (reflected_point - centroid)
197        return self._apply_bounds(expanded)
198
199    def _contract_outside(self, centroid: np.ndarray, reflected_point: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
200        """Perform outside contraction."""
201        contracted = centroid + self.current_contraction * (reflected_point - centroid)
202        return self._apply_bounds(contracted)
203
204    def _contract_inside(self, centroid: np.ndarray, worst_vertex: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
205        """Perform inside contraction."""
206        contracted = centroid + self.current_contraction * (worst_vertex - centroid)
207        return self._apply_bounds(contracted)
208
209    def _shrink_simplex(self):
210        """Shrink the entire simplex."""
211        self.simplex.shrink_simplex(self.current_shrinkage)
212
213        # Re-evaluate all vertices except the best one
214        for i in range(1, len(self.simplex.vertices)):
215            self.simplex.vertices[i] = self._apply_bounds(self.simplex.vertices[i])
216            self.simplex.function_values[i] = self._safe_evaluate(self.simplex.vertices[i])
217
218        self.simplex._sort_vertices()
219
220    def _apply_bounds(self, point: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
221        """Apply parameter bounds to a point."""
222        return np.clip(point,
223                      self.parameter_space.lower_bounds,
224                      self.parameter_space.upper_bounds)
225
226    def _safe_evaluate(self, point: np.ndarray) -> float:
227        """Safely evaluate objective function."""
228        try:
229            value = self.problem.evaluate(point)
230            self.n_evaluations += 1
231            return value
232        except Exception as e:
233            warnings.warn(f"Evaluation failed: {e}")
234            return float('inf')
235
236    def _update_adaptive_parameters(self):
237        """Update adaptive algorithm parameters."""
238        # Adjust parameters based on convergence progress
239        if len(self.convergence_history) > 10:
240            recent_improvement = (self.convergence_history[-10] -
241                                self.convergence_history[-1])
242
243            if recent_improvement < 1e-8:
244                # Slow convergence - increase exploration
245                self.current_reflection = min(self.current_reflection * 1.1, 2.0)
246                self.current_expansion = min(self.current_expansion * 1.05, 3.0)
247                self.current_contraction = max(self.current_contraction * 0.95, 0.1)
248            else:
249                # Good convergence - reset to default values
250                self.current_reflection = self.config.reflection_coeff
251                self.current_expansion = self.config.expansion_coeff
252                self.current_contraction = self.config.contraction_coeff
253
254    def _check_termination(self) -> bool:
255        """Check termination conditions."""
256        # Maximum iterations
257        if self.iteration >= self.config.max_iterations:
258            return True
259
260        # Maximum evaluations
261        if self.n_evaluations >= self.config.max_evaluations:
262            return True
263
264        # Convergence tolerance
265        if self.simplex is not None and len(self.convergence_history) > 1:
266            # Function value tolerance
267            function_range = (self.simplex.worst_value - self.simplex.best_value)
268            if abs(function_range) < self.config.tolerance:
269                return True
270
271            # Simplex size tolerance
272            if self.simplex.volume() < self.config.tolerance:
273                return True
274
275            # Stagnation check
276            if len(self.convergence_history) > 20:
277                recent_change = abs(self.convergence_history[-1] - self.convergence_history[-20])
278                if recent_change < self.config.tolerance:
279                    return True
280
281        return False
282
283    def _create_result(self) -> OptimizationResult:
284        """Create optimization result."""
285        if self.simplex is None:
286            return OptimizationResult(
287                best_parameters=np.array([]),
288                best_value=float('inf'),
289                n_evaluations=self.n_evaluations,
290                convergence_history=[],
291                success=False,
292                algorithm_info={'algorithm': 'NelderMead'}
293            )
294
295        return OptimizationResult(
296            best_parameters=self.simplex.best_vertex.copy(),
297            best_value=self.simplex.best_value,
298            n_evaluations=self.n_evaluations,
299            convergence_history=self.convergence_history.copy(),
300            success=np.isfinite(self.simplex.best_value),
301            algorithm_info={
302                'algorithm': 'NelderMead',
303                'iterations': self.iteration,
304                'final_simplex_volume': self.simplex.volume(),
305                'function_range': self.simplex.worst_value - self.simplex.best_value,
306                'adaptive_reflection': self.current_reflection,
307                'adaptive_expansion': self.current_expansion,
308                'adaptive_contraction': self.current_contraction
309            }
310        )
311
312    def get_simplex_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
313        """Get information about current simplex."""
314        if self.simplex is None:
315            return {}
316
317        return {
318            'iteration': self.iteration,
319            'n_evaluations': self.n_evaluations,
320            'best_vertex': self.simplex.best_vertex.tolist(),
321            'best_value': self.simplex.best_value,
322            'worst_value': self.simplex.worst_value,
323            'function_range': self.simplex.worst_value - self.simplex.best_value,
324            'simplex_volume': self.simplex.volume(),
325            'centroid': self.simplex.centroid().tolist(),
326            'convergence_rate': self._estimate_convergence_rate()
327        }
328
329    def _estimate_convergence_rate(self) -> float:
330        """Estimate convergence rate."""
331        if len(self.convergence_history) < 10:
332            return 0.0
333
334        # Calculate exponential convergence rate
335        recent_history = self.convergence_history[-10:]
336        if len(set(recent_history)) <= 1:  # All values the same
337            return 0.0
338
339        try:
340            # Fit exponential decay
341            x = np.arange(len(recent_history))
342            y = np.array(recent_history)
343
344            # Avoid log of non-positive numbers
345            y_shifted = y - np.min(y) + 1e-10
346            log_y = np.log(y_shifted)
347
348            slope, _ = np.polyfit(x, log_y, 1)
349            return abs(slope)
350        except Exception:
351            return 0.0
352
353    def restart_simplex(self, perturbation_factor: float = 0.1):
354        """Restart simplex with perturbation."""
355        if self.simplex is None:
356            return
357
358        # Keep best vertex, perturb others
359        best_vertex = self.simplex.best_vertex.copy()
360        ranges = self.parameter_space.upper_bounds - self.parameter_space.lower_bounds
361        perturbation = perturbation_factor * ranges
362
363        new_vertices = [best_vertex]
364        for i in range(self.dimension):
365            new_vertex = best_vertex.copy()
366            new_vertex[i] += np.random.normal(0, perturbation[i])
367            new_vertex = self._apply_bounds(new_vertex)
368            new_vertices.append(new_vertex)
369
370        # Evaluate new vertices
371        function_values = []
372        for vertex in new_vertices:
373            value = self._safe_evaluate(vertex)
374            function_values.append(value)
375
376        self.simplex = NelderMeadSimplex(new_vertices, function_values)
